abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker is inaugurated for second term, but he has made it clear he does not want to push fight with labor unions that was hallmark of his first term; visible members of Republican majority in state legislature want to continue battle with labor, now facing off against private-sector unions.
lead_paragraph: The governor has indicated that he does not want to expand the fight with labor that defined his first term, but fellow Republicans seem determined to challenge the power of unions.
snippet: The governor has indicated that he does not want to expand the fight with labor that defined his first term, but fellow Republicans seem determined to challenge the power of unions.

headline.main: Scott Walker, Starting Second Term as Wisconsin Governor, Resists New Union Battle
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin Governor, Starting Second Term, Resists New Union Battle
